talk.utter: The shoewax tutorial is so fascinating! I guess there was some translating mix-up because the steps are "3, 2, 1, 4" etc. Someone went with Western numbering (from top left) while the original starts on the top right. This is so interesting compared to the level of detail in the tutorial itself!

talk.author: did:plc:7vdwh4nxv6nyre3chqn27i46
talk.utter: Is it really though? They even added arrows to make it clearer, and it's perfectly easy to follow each tutorial and step, even to the point where I never noticed this.

talk.author: did:plc:mqvjl5trp4f6cvg7idlasfjv
talk.utter: Oh, it's not unusable! But there's definitely some tension between the (I assume) original Japanese text and the English layout. I love these artefacts because they tell me something about how the text was constructed. Was it a layout template? Did the editor and graphics have different ideas

about how to accommodate Japanese vs English reading habits? Different knowledge? Were the arrows a later addition when someone noticed the mistake or a leftover from a Japanese version?
